channel.title: Login error

item.title: Login error
item.dc:creator: @jailed jailed
item.description:
@jailed wrote:

i recently added these codes

} else if (token.equals("character-alien")) { alien = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-ninja")) { ninja = Integer.parseInt(token2); } else if (token.equals("character-human")) { human = Integer.parseInt(token2);

characterfile.write("character-alien = ", 0, 22); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(alien), 0, Integer.toString(alien).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-ninja = ", 0, 21); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(ninja), 0, Integer.toString(ninja).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("character-human = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(human), 0, Integer.toString(human).length()); characterfile.newLine();

public int alien; public int ninja; public int human;

and no.one can log on their old accounts, they have to create a new one.
and if they log out the new one they have to create another one to log in.
i removed the codes and then everything worked fine, but i still want this to work.
is there something wrong with the codes, did i forget to add a code somewhere?

edit: when i have the codes added and they try to log into their account everything inside the characters file dissapears, but the file is there. so it wont load anything when they try to log in

Read full topic
